It's still not clear whether the state of Utah will put its most famous polygamist on trial.
Warren Jeffs leads the largest polygamous religion in the nation.
He is charged with two counts of facilitating rape.
But a preliminary hearing on the case ended yesterday with no firm conclusion.
NPR's Howard Berkes was in the courtroom in St. George, Utah.
There were sharpshooters on the red rock cliffs above the courthouse and a fleet of satellite TV trucks choking the parking lot.
